description.value: When the [[lookup @name lowercase]] hasn’t spit its Acid Breath, the acid built up within the [[lookup @name lowercase]] causes the patina on its scales to spread to weapons that strike it. While the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s Acid Breath is available, any weapon made of metal that hits the [[lookup @name lowercase]] corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to damage rolls. If a nonmagical weapon’s penalty drops to −5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal that hits the [[lookup @name lowercase]] is destroyed after dealing damage. A magical weapon can’t have a penalty greater than −5, and a magical weapon removes this penalty after 24 hours or after its attuned wielder finishes a long rest.
If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] fails a save, it can choose to succeed instead.
The dragon uses its Frightful Presence. It then makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks. It can replace its Bite attack with a use of Slowing Breath, if available.
Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]], reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.
Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]], reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.
Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]], reach 20 ft., one creature. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Every creature of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s choice within 120 ft. of it must succeed on a [[/save]] save or become &Reference[frightened]{frightened} of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect for itself on a success. If a creature’s save succeeds or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

The [[lookup @name lowercase]] exhales acid in a 120-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a [[/save format=long]], taking [[/damage average]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The dragon exhales slowing gas in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a [[/save format=long]]. On a failure, the creature can’t use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can’t make more than one attack on its turn. In addition, the creature can use either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. These effects last for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

The dragon magically transforms into a Beast or Humanoid that has a challenge rating no higher than its own, or back into its true form, which is Dragon. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying transforms with it or is borne by the new form (the dragon’s choice). It reverts to its true form if it dies. In a new form, the dragon retains its Legendary Resistance trait and its HP, ability to speak, proficiencies, and INT, WIS, and CHA scores, as well as this bonus action. Its statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] automatically detects every creature and trap within 30 feet of it, pinpointing the current location of each.

The [[lookup @name lowercase]] roars at up to two creatures of its choice within 120 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a [[/save]] save or be vulnerable to acid damage until the end of its next turn. A target resistant to acid damage isn’t resistant to it for the duration. A target immune to acid damage is still immune to it, even if the target fails the save.

The [[lookup @name lowercase]] beats its wings. Each creature within 15 feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] must succeed on a [[/save]] save or take [[/damage average]] damage and be knocked &Reference[prone]{prone}. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can then fly up to half its flying speed without provoking opportunity attacks.
